content: The Act may be cited as the "Homeland Security Civil Rights and Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2004". The mission of the Department of Homeland Security is outlined in the Act. The "Homeland Security Civil Rights and Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2004" amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to ensure that civil rights and liberties are not compromised in efforts to secure the homeland. SEC. 3. OFFICER FOR CIVIL RIGHTS AND CIVIL LIBERTIES. Section 705(a) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to require the officer for civil rights and civil liberties to report directly to the Secretary and address concerns of profiling on the basis of race, ethnicity, or religion. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to address concerns of profiling based on race, ethnicity, or religion and ensure the protection of civil rights and civil liberties. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to address concerns of profiling based on race, ethnicity, or religion and ensure the protection of civil rights and civil liberties by incorporating appropriate policies and procedures to oversee compliance with legal requirements. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to address concerns of profiling based on race, ethnicity, or religion and ensure the protection of civil rights and civil liberties by overseeing compliance with legal requirements and coordinating programs involving civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy considerations. The Department oversees programs and activities, coordinates with officials on civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy issues, and investigates complaints of possible abuses. The Department oversees programs, coordinates on civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy issues, and investigates complaints of possible abuses. Congress receives reports on programs, policies, and procedures, and investigates complaints of civil rights or civil liberties abuses. SEC. 4. PROTECTION OF CIVIL RIGHTS AND CIVIL LIBERTIES BY OFFICE OF INSPECTOR GENERAL. Designation and Functions of Senior Official. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include the protection of civil rights and civil liberties by the Office of Inspector General. The Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of abuses of civil rights or civil liberties and review complaints and information. The senior official designated under subsection (a) coordinates investigations of abuses of civil rights or civil liberties, reviews complaints, and initiates investigations of alleged abuses by employees or officials of the Department of Homeland Security or independent contractors. The designated senior official coordinates investigations of civil rights and liberties abuses by Department of Homeland Security employees or contractors, ensuring personnel in the Office of Inspector General are trained for effective investigations. The designated senior official coordinates investigations of civil rights and liberties abuses by Department of Homeland Security employees or contractors, ensuring personnel in the Office of Inspector General receive sufficient training for effective investigations. They also consult with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties regarding alleged abuses and policy recommendations. The designated senior official coordinates civil rights and civil liberties investigations, consults with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties on alleged abuses and policy recommendations, and provides information on investigation outcomes. The Office of Inspector General ensures public access to information on civil rights and civil liberties investigations, refers matters not investigated to the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, and provides outcomes of investigations. The Office of Inspector General ensures public access to information on civil rights and civil liberties investigations, refers unresolved matters to the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, and updates the public on investigation outcomes. The Office of Inspector General is responsible for handling complaints and investigations related to civil rights and civil liberties matters within the Department. They are required to inform the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties of any issues or deficiencies identified. The Office of Inspector General is responsible for protecting civil rights and civil liberties within the Department, and they must inform the Privacy Officer of any issues or deficiencies identified. Section 222 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include the requirement for coordination with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties to ensure programs and policies align with civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include coordination with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties to ensure integrated and comprehensive handling of programs, policies, and procedures related to civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy. This includes providing appropriate reports to Congress on these matters.
